meanings.definition: A different form or version of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist created various variations of the painting.
meanings.sent2: There are many variations of this song available online.
meanings.sent3: The chef's playful variations on the classic dish surprised the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her mood showed more variations than a chameleon's colors.
meanings.sent5: The endless variations of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: The act, process, or result of varying or changing.
meanings.sent1: The constant variations in weather make it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: The variations in temperature can affect the growth of plants.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected variations in the plot kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The variations in her voice revealed her emotions more than words could.
meanings.sent5: The variations in the melody added depth and emotion to the music.

meanings.definition: Differences or deviations from a standard or norm.
meanings.sent1: The genetic variations among siblings can lead to different traits.
meanings.sent2: Cultural variations can be seen in the way people celebrate holidays.
meanings.sent3: The variations in spelling between British and American English can be confusing.
meanings.sent4: The variations in opinions sparked a lively debate among the group.
meanings.sent5: The variations in texture made the fabric unique and interesting.
